item.title: HACL Packages v0.6
item.description: Today, we announce the first release of the HACL Packages libraries. ðŸŽ‰ This release of HACL packages includes the first release of the HACL C library and a new release of the hacl-star OCaml bindings.

item.title: OpenMLS
item.description: We have joined forces with our friends from Phoenix R&D to improve OpenMLS. The MLS protocol draft is in the IETF working group’s last call and is thus on track to become an RFC soon.

item.title: HACL Packages
item.description: Earlier this year, Tezos and Nomadic Labs started to work with Cryspen to improve HACL* and ensure that it is a viable long-term solution for Tezos' cryptographic needs.

item.title: What is High Assurance Cryptography?
item.description: Cryspen builds high assurance cryptography. But what does this actually mean? Before focusing on cryptography it is interesting to look at high assurance software in general.

item.title: An Executable HPKE Specification
item.description: HPKE, published as RFC 9180, describes a scheme for hybrid public key encryption. ðŸ“š Please go and read our TL;DR on HPKE if you nee more background on HPKE.

item.title: TL;DR - Hybrid Public Key Encryption
item.description: HPKE, defined in RFC 9180, is a CFRG standard that describes a scheme for hybrid public key encryption. It is co-authored by my Cryspen co-founder Karthikeyan Bhargavan and one of his PhD students Benjamin Lipp as part of his research at Inria.

item.title: Cryspen ERC PoC Grant
item.description: Cryspen co-founder Karthik Bhargavan got awarded an ERC Proof of Concept grant for commercialising the know-how and landmark research results from his Inria research group PROSECCO through Cryspen.
